Back: Utility-first CSS framework for rapid UI development (no prebuilt components)
Composable utility classes instead of semantic CSS (e.g., 'flex' vs 'navbar')
npm install -D tailwindcss + npx tailwindcss init (or CDN for quick tests)
tailwind.config.js - defines colors, fonts, breakpoints, plugins etc.
content: [] specifies files to scan for class purging (JIT mode)
Prefix utilities with breakpoint: 'md:text-center' (sm, md, lg, xl, 2xl)
Unprefixed utilities apply to all screens, prefixed override larger breakpoints
'@layer utilities' in CSS to create new utility classes
Extend with plugins: npm install @tailwindcss/forms, typography etc.
darkMode: 'class' in config (manual toggle with 'dark' class)
'container' centers content with max-width at breakpoints
'sr-only' hides visually but keeps for screen readers
'group' parent + 'group-hover:' to style children on hover
Define keyframes in config: keyframes: { spin: { to: { transform: 'rotate(360deg)' } } }
